author: arnetheduck
content: hm, is there a reason the genesis fork version is not included in the state? since it's needed to verify deposits, it'll not be possible to bootstrap with just state, down the road, when we've gone through 2 forks

author: benjaminion
content: GFV is a configuration parameter, just like many of the other parameters that are outside the state, but are needed to run/verify the chain. For example DOMAIN_DEPOSIT is also needed, but that's not in the state either.

author: djrtwo
content: True, <@!449019668296892420>. There really is an implicit input to the state transition (the configuration). Note that the upgrade path for configuration is to never overwrite but only to add -- e.g. `PHASE_1_MAX_DEPOSITS` if we wanted to change max deposits per block in phase 1 -- so you'll always have access to that un-tainted genesis fork param
